The Michaelis constantis the substrate concentration at which the reaction rate is at half-maximum, and is an inverse measure of the substrate's affinity for the enzymeâ€”as a smallindicates high affinity, meaning that the rate will approachmore quickly.[5] The value ofis dependent on both the enzyme and the substrate, as well as conditions such as temperature and pH. Alejandra Gonzalez-Beltran Orlaith Burke Philippe Rocca-Serra
